glsa.title: Lighttpd: Two Denials of Service
glsa.synopsis: Two vulnerabilities have been discovered in Lighttpd, each allowing for a Denial of Service.

background.p: Lighttpd is a lightweight HTTP web server.

description.p: Robert Jakabosky discovered an infinite loop triggered by a connection abort when Lighttpd processes carriage return and line feed sequences. Marcus Rueckert discovered a NULL pointer dereference when a server running Lighttpd tries to access a file with a mtime of 0.

impact.p: A remote attacker could upload a specially crafted file to the server or send a specially crafted request and then abort the connection, possibly resulting in a crash or a Denial of Service by CPU consumption.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
